meanings.definition: To drill a hole before inserting a screw or nail.
meanings.sent1: Before I put in the screw, I always predrill a hole to make it easier.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter predrilled the holes in the wood before assembling the furniture.
meanings.sent3: Why did the impatient screwdriver refuse to wait for the predrilling party? Because it wanted to get the job done quickly!
meanings.sent4: She predrilled the path for success, ensuring smooth progress in her project.
meanings.sent5: The predrilling technique saved time and effort, making the task a breeze.

meanings.definition: The act of drilling a hole before inserting a screw or nail.
meanings.sent1: The predrilling of holes is essential for sturdy construction.
meanings.sent2: He learned the importance of predrilling while working on his woodworking project.
meanings.sent3: The predrilling ceremony at the construction site was a hit among the workers.
meanings.sent4: Her precision in predrilling earned her the title of 'Master of Holes'.
meanings.sent5: The sound of predrilling echoed through the workshop, signaling the start of a new project.
